result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J Haluska was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas J Haluska is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thomas J Haluska was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED. Consec to 14CF834. Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$250 DNA surcharge + court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Drug Treatment Court.  Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.

records.addlTxt: Due to def's successful completion of the Earned Release Program on 1/20/17, court ordered DOC to effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this Order.
Ct ordered zero restitution
From DOC regarding clarification on DNA surcharges.

Defendant appeared with Attorney Jeff Nichols. Ismael Ozanne appeared for the State. James Pearson appeared for JMH. State moved for termination. Attorney Nichols requested setover; Court decided to continue with termination hearing. Defendant made statement. Court terminated defendant's involvement in drug court program. Files to be sent to trial branch for scheduling.
State moved to adjourn hearing in order to receive additional information. Hearing adjourned to 6/23/2015 at 11:30 AM.

Defendant appeared, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Nichols. Attorney Ismael Ozanne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. James Pearson appeared for JMH. State requested that termination hearing be adjourned for at least 2 weeks. Attorney Nicholas did not object. Termination hearing rescheduled to June 2, 2015 at 11:00 AM.
of Intent to Terminate Drug Court Diversion Contract- filed by State of Wisconsin. Termination Hearing scheduled 5/12/15 at 11:00 AM.
